dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my gosh, did you SEE this?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my gosh, did you S E E this?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right?! Like, "the richest people aren't immune"? Um, duh!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right?! Like, the richest people aren't immune? Um, duh!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The richest people on Earth are not immune to the coronavirus.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But wait, uh, the numbers! Fifty-eight fewer than last year! Two hundred twenty-six in twelve days?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But wait, uh, the numbers! Fifty-eight fewer than last year! Two hundred twenty-six in twelve days?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Forbes counted 2,095 billionaires, 58 fewer than a year ago and 226 fewer than just 12 days earlier, when we initially calculated these net worths.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly! And half of them are poorer. Like, seven hundred billion dollars wiped out, total.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly! And half of them are poorer. Like, seven hundred billion dollars wiped out, total.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Of the billionaires who remain, 51% are poorer than they were last year. In raw terms, the worlds billionaires are worth $8 trillion, down $700 billion from 2019.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, you'd think they were untouchable, right? But then... Jeff Bezos. Still number one.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, you'd think they were untouchable, right? But then... Jeff Bezos. Still number one.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Jeff Bezos is the worlds wealthiest person for the third year in a row, despite giving $36 billion worth of his Amazon stock to his ex-wife MacKenzie Bezos as part of their divorce settlement last summer.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: YES! Even after giving MacKenzie thirty-six billion! How does that even happen?!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Y E S! Even after giving MacKenzie thirty-six billion! How does that even happen?!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Jeff Bezos is the worlds wealthiest person for the third year in a row, despite giving $36 billion worth of his Amazon stock to his ex-wife MacKenzie Bezos as part of their divorce settlement last summer.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Amazon shares, right? Fifteen percent up! And they're, like, hiring a hundred thousand people.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Amazon shares, right? Fifteen percent up! And they're, like, hiring a hundred thousand people.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hes worth $113 billion, buoyed by a 15% rise in Amazons shares since our 2019 list. The e-commerce giant he runs has been in the spotlight amid the pandemic; its hiring 100,000 full- and part-time workers to help meet increased demand from consumers staying home and shopping online.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And getting those tax breaks! Um, meanwhile, this other guy, the pig breeder?!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And getting those tax breaks! Um, meanwhile, this other guy, the pig breeder?!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my gosh, I saw that! Qin Yinglin! The richest pig breeder in the world!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my gosh, I saw that! Qin Yinglin! The richest pig breeder in the world!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The biggest gainer in dollar terms is Qin Yinglin, the worlds richest pig breeder.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: A fourteen-billion-dollar jump! Because of, wait for it, African swine flu!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A fourteen-billion-dollar jump! Because of, wait for it, African swine flu!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hes ranked No. 43 and is worth $18.5 billion--a $14.2 billion jump since the 2019 list, after shares of his Shenzhen-listed Muyuan Foods nearly tripled as the African swine flu reduced the supply of pigs and drove up prices.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly! And like, the government promoting eating more pork. Insane!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly! And like, the government promoting eating more pork. Insane!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's wild how some just... thrived. Like Eric Yuan from Zoom!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's wild how some just... thrived. Like Eric Yuan from Zoom!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Still, Forbes found 178 newcomers hailing from 20 countries, including some, like Zoom Video Communications founder and CEO Eric Yuan, whose service is booming amid our current shelter-in-place reality.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the shelter-in-place economy, uh, really created some new wealth.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the shelter-in-place economy, uh, really created some new wealth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Still, Forbes found 178 newcomers hailing from 20 countries, including some, like Zoom Video Communications founder and CEO Eric Yuan, whose service is booming amid our current shelter-in-place reality.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. While Adam Neumann, like, fell right off the list. WeWork, poof!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. While Adam Neumann, like, fell right off the list. WeWork, poof!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Altogether, 267 people who made last years list have dropped off as businesses faltered; among the most notable drop-offs is Adam Neumann of WeWork.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's just a crazy, crazy snapshot of, um, who wins and loses.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's just a crazy, crazy snapshot of, um, who wins and loses.
